parameters.description: Maximum number of items to provide in the result. Must be a positive integer value. Default value is 20 and maximum value is 100

AlertIdentifier.name: identifier
AlertIdentifier.description: Identifier of alert which could be alert id, tiny id or alert alias

AlertIdentifierType.name: identifierType
AlertIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id', 'alias' or 'tiny'

AlertSourceParam.name: source
AlertSourceParam.description: Display name of the request source

AlertUserParam.name: user
AlertUserParam.description: Display name of the request owner

OffsetParam.name: offset
OffsetParam.description: Starting value of the offset property

PageDirectionParam.name: direction
PageDirectionParam.description: Page direction to apply for the given offset with 'next' and 'prev'

AlertLimitParam.name: limit
AlertLimitParam.description: Maximum number of items to provide in the result. Must be a positive integer value. Default value is 20 and maximum value is 100

SearchIdentifier.name: identifier
SearchIdentifier.description: Identifier of the saved search which could be 'id' or 'name'

SearchIdentifierType.name: identifierType
SearchIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id', or 'name'

AlertIdentifierType2.name: alertIdentifierType
AlertIdentifierType2.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id', 'alias' or 'tiny'

IntegrationType.name: type
IntegrationType.description: Type of the integration (For instance, "API" for API Integration). If type parameter is given, the result will be filtered by type

IntegrationTeamId.name: teamId
IntegrationTeamId.description: The ID of the team. If the team ID parameter is given, the result will be filtered by teamId

IntegrationTeamName.name: teamName
IntegrationTeamName.description: The name of the team. If the team name parameter is given, the result will be filtered by teamName

TeamId.name: teamId
TeamId.description: TeamId of policy created if it belongs to a team

MaintenanceIdentifier.name: id
MaintenanceIdentifier.description: Identifier of the maintenance to be searched

MaintenanceListType.name: type
MaintenanceListType.description: Type of the maintenance list to be searched

UserIdentifier.name: identifier
UserIdentifier.description: Identifier of the user to be searched

UserOffsetParam.name: offset
UserOffsetParam.description: Number of users to skip from start

UserSortParam.name: sortField
UserSortParam.description: Field to use in sorting. Should be one of 'username', 'fullName' and 'insertedAt'

UserOrderParam.name: order
UserOrderParam.description: Direction of sorting. Should be one of 'asc' or 'desc'

UserQueryParam.name: query
UserQueryParam.description: Field:value combinations with most of user fields to make more advanced searches. Possible fields are username, fullName, blocked, verified, role, locale, timeZone, userAddress and createdAt

NotificationRuleIdentifier.name: ruleId
NotificationRuleIdentifier.description: Id of the notification rule that step will belong to.

NotificationRuleStepId.name: id
NotificationRuleStepId.description: Id of the rule step will be changed.

TeamIdentifierType.name: identifierType
TeamIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier. Possible values are 'id' and 'name'. Default value is 'id'

TeamIdentifierType2.name: teamIdentifierType
TeamIdentifierType2.description: Type of the identifier. Possible values are 'id' and 'name'. Default value is 'id'

TeamLimitParam.name: limit
TeamLimitParam.description: Maximum number of items to provide in the result. Must be a positive integer value.

TeamOffsetParam.name: offset
TeamOffsetParam.description: Key which will be used in pagination

MemberIdentifier.name: memberIdentifier
MemberIdentifier.description: User id or username of member for removal

TeamRoleIdentifier.name: teamRoleIdentifier
TeamRoleIdentifier.description: Identifier of team role which could be team role 'id' or 'name'

TeamRoleIdentifierType.name: identifierType
TeamRoleIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id' or 'name'

TeamRoutingRuleId.name: id
TeamRoutingRuleId.description: Id of the team routing rule

ScheduleIdentifier.name: identifier
ScheduleIdentifier.description: Identifier of schedule which could be id or name

ScheduleIdentifierType.name: identifierType
ScheduleIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id' or 'name'

ScheduleIdentifierType2.name: scheduleIdentifierType
ScheduleIdentifierType2.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id' or 'name'

WhoIsOnCallFlat.name: flat
WhoIsOnCallFlat.description: Retrieves user names of all on call participants if enabled

EscalationIdentifier.name: identifier
EscalationIdentifier.description: Identifier of escalation which could be escalation 'id' or 'name'

EscalationIdentifierType.name: identifierType
EscalationIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id' or 'name'

ForwardingRuleIdentifierType.name: identifierType
ForwardingRuleIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id' or 'alias'

CustomUserRoleIdentifier.name: identifier

CustomUserRoleIdentifierType.name: identifierType
CustomUserRoleIdentifierType.description: Type of the identifier that is provided as an in-line parameter. Possible values are 'id' or 'name'

IncidentIdentifier.name: identifier

ServiceIncidentRuleId.name: id
ServiceIncidentRuleId.description: Id of the service incident rule

Ok.description: Returns request id for this async operation.

Accepted.description: Returns request id for this async operation.

Unauthorized.description: apiKey is invalid or integration is disabled

PaymentRequired.description: apiKey is valid but the account cannot do this action because of subscription plan

Forbidden.description: apiKey is valid but the apiKey cannot do this operation because of permissions

NotFound.description: Entity cannot be found for the given identifier

Filter.description: Defines the conditions that will be checked before applying rules and type of the operations that will be applied on conditions

field.description: Specifies which alert field will be used in condition. Possible values are message, alias, description, source, entity, tags, actions, extra-properties, recipients, responders or teams

key.description: If field is set as extra-properties, key could be used for key-value pair

not.description: Indicates behaviour of the given operation. Default value is false

operation.description: It is the operation that will be executed for the given field and key.

expectedValue.description: User defined value that will be compared with alert field according to the operation. Default value is empty string

order.description: Order of the condition in conditions list

user.description: Display name of the request owner

note.description: Additional note that will be added while creating the alert

source.description: Source field of the alert. Default value is IP address of the incoming request

alias.description: Client-defined identifier of the alert, that is also the key element of alert deduplication.

description.description: Description field of the alert that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the alert.

responders.description: Responders that the alert will be routed to send notifications

visibleTo.description: Teams and users that the alert will become visible to without sending any notification

actions.description: Custom actions that will be available for the alert

details.description: Map of key-value pairs to use as custom properties of the alert

entity.description: Entity field of the alert that is generally used to specify which domain alert is related to

endTime.description: Date and time that snooze will lose effect

details.description: Key-value pairs to add as custom property into alert.

teams.description: Teams that the alert will be routed to send notifications
Teams that the alert will be routed to send notifications

description.description: Description of the alert

type.description: Type of the integration. (For instance, "API" for API Integration)

name.description: Name of the integration. Name must be unique for each integration

enabled.description: This parameter is for specifying whether the integration will be enabled or not

suppressNotifications.description: If enabled, notifications that come from alerts will be suppressed. Defaults to false

ignoreTeamsFromPayload.description: If enabled, the integration will ignore teams sent in request payloads. Defaults to false

ignoreRecipientsFromPayload.description: If enabled, the integration will ignore recipients sent in request payloads. Defaults to false

recipients.description: Optional user, schedule, teams or escalation names to calculate which users will receive the notifications of the alert. Recipients which are exceeding the limit are ignored

emailUsername.description: The username part of the email address. It must be unique for each integration

allowConfigurationAccess.description: This parameter is for allowing or restricting the configuration access. If configuration access is restricted, the integration will be limited to Alert API requests and sending heartbeats. Defaults to false

allowWriteAccess.description: This parameter is for configuring the read-only access of integration. If the integration is limited to read-only access, the integration will not be authorized to perform any create, update or delete action within any domain. Defaults to true

description.description: An optional description of the heartbeat

interval.description: Specifies how often a heartbeat message should be expected

ownerTeam.description: Owner team of the heartbeat, consisting id and/or name of the owner team

alertMessage.description: Specifies the alert message for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default alert message is 'HeartbeatName is expired'

alertTags.description: Specifies the alert tags for heartbeat expiration alert

alertPriority.description: Specifies the alert priority for heartbeat expiration alert. If this is not provided, default priority is P3

description.description: An optional description of the heartbeat

interval.description: Specifies how often a heartbeat message should be expected

targetIndex.description: Order of the target policy will be changed to this value. Larger values than policy count will put the target policy to last place

filter.description: Conditions specified in this field must be met for this policy to work

timeRestrictions.description: Time restrictions specified in this field must be met for this policy to work

enabled.description: Activity status of the alert policy

ignoreOriginalDetails.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original details of the alert. Default value is false

ignoreOriginalRecipients.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original recipients of the alert. Default value is false

ignoreOriginalTags.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original tags of the alert. Default value is false

ignoreOriginalTeams.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original teams of the alert. Default value is false

continue.description: Will continue with other modify policies if set to true

alias.description: Alias of the alert. You can use {{alias}} to refer to the original alias. Default value is {{alias}}

description.description: Description of the alert. You can use {{description}} to refer to the original alert description. Default value is {{description}}

entity.description: Entity field of the alert. You can use {{entity}} to refer to the original entity. Default value is {{entity}}

source.description: Source field of the alert. You can use {{source}} to refer to the original source. Default value is {{source}}

actions.description: Alert actions as a list of strings to add to the alerts original actions value. If ignoreOriginalAlertActions field is set to true, this will replace the original actions.

recipients.description: Recipients to add to the alerts original recipients value as a list of escalations, schedules, teams, users or the reserved word none or all. If ignoreOriginalRecipients field is set to true, this will replace the original recipients.

tags.description: Tags to add to the alerts original tags value as a list of strings. If ignoreOriginalRecipients field is set to true, this will replace the original recipients.

details.description: Custom properties to add to the alerts original details value as a list of strings. If ignoreOriginalDetails field is set to true, this will replace the original details.

duration.description: Duration to wait before closing the alert
Interval to keep count of alerts for frequency based deduplication
Interval to keep count of alerts for frequency based deduplication
Duration to wait before restarting the notification flow

maxRepeatCount.description: Max restart count of the notification flow

description.description: Description for the maintenance

rules.description: Rules of maintenance, which takes a list of rule objects and defines the maintenance rules over integrations and policies.

rules.description: Rules of maintenance, which takes a list of rule objects and defines the maintenance rules over integrations and policies.

startDate.description: Start time of the time configuration of maintenance

endDate.description: End time of the time configuration of maintenance

id.description: Identifier of the maintenance meta data

status.description: Status of the maintenance meta data

state.description: Defines the state of the rule

role.description: Role of user. It may be one of owner, admin, user or the name of a custom role you've created.

timeZone.description: Timezone of the user. If not set, timezone of the customer will be used instead.

locale.description: Location information of the user. If not set, locale of the customer will be used instead.

tags.description: List of labels attached to the user. You can label users to differentiate them from the rest. For example, you can add ITManager tag to differentiate people with this role from others.

invitationDisabled.description: Invitation email will not be sent if set to true. Default value is false

locale.description: Location information of the user. If not set, locale of the customer will be used instead.

notificationTime.description: List of Time Periods that notification for schedule start/end will be sent

timeRestriction.description: Time interval that notification rule will work

schedules.description: List of schedules that notification rule will be applied when on call of that schedule starts/ends. This field is valid for Schedule Start/End rules

order.description: The order of the notification rule within the notification rules with the same action type

steps.description: List of steps that will be added to notification rule

enabled.description: Defines if notification rule will be enabled or not when it is created

steps.description: List of steps that will be added to notification rule

repeat.description: The amount of time in minutes that notification steps will be repeatedly apply

contact.description: The contact that notification will be sent to.

sendAfter.description: Time period (in minute) when notification will be sent after.

description.description: The description of team

members.description: The users which will be added to team, and optionally their roles.

description.description: The description of team

user.description: Member identifier of the team, consisting 'id' and/or 'username'

role.description: Member role of the user, consisting 'user', 'admin' or a custom team role. Default value is 'user'
Member role of the user, consisting 'user', 'admin' or a custom team role. Default value is 'user'

name.description: Name of the team routing rule

order.description: Order of team routing rule within the rules. order value is actually the index of the team routing rule.

timezone.description: Timezone of team routing rule. If timezone field is not given, account timezone is used as default.

timezone.description: Timezone of team routing rule. If timezone field is not given, account timezone is used as default.

description.description: The description of schedule

ownerTeam.description: Owner team of the schedule, consisting id and/or name of the owner team

description.description: The description of schedule

ownerTeam.description: Owner team of the schedule, consisting id and/or name of the owner team

startDate.description: Defines a date time as an override start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

endDate.description: Defines a date time as an override end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

type.description: Type of rotation. May be one of 'daily', 'weekly' and 'hourly'

length.description: Length of the rotation with default value 1

participants.description: List of escalations, teams, users or the reserved word none which will be used in schedule. Each of them can be used multiple times and will be rotated in the order they given.

timeRestriction.description: Used to limit schedule rotation to certain day and time of the week, using multiple start and end times for each day of the week.

startDate.description: Defines a date time as an override start. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

endDate.description: Defines a date time as an override end. Minutes may take 0 or 30 as value. Otherwise they will be converted to nearest 0 or 30 automatically

type.description: Type of rotation. May be one of 'daily', 'weekly' and 'hourly'

length.description: Length of the rotation with default value 1

alias.description: A user defined identifier for the override

user.description: The user object who will take on call responsibility or reserved word none

rotations.description: Identifier (id or name) of rotations that override will apply. When it's set, only specified schedule rotations will be overridden

toUser.description: The user who will receive the forwarded notifications.

endDate.description: The date and time for forwarding will end

toUser.description: The user who will receive the forwarded notifications.

extendedRole.description: Custom role. Must not be one of the defined values (i.e. "user", "observer", "stakeholder")

grantedRights.description: Rights granted to the custom user role.

disallowedRights.description: Rights disallowed for the custom user role.

disallowedRights.description: Rights disallowed for the custom user role.

targetIndex.description: Order of the target policy will be changed to this value. Larger values than policy count will put the target policy to last place

filter.description: Conditions specified in this field must be met for this policy to work

timeRestrictions.description: Time restrictions specified in this field must be met for this policy to work

enabled.description: Activity status of the alert policy

ignoreOriginalDetails.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original details of the alert. Default value is false

ignoreOriginalResponders.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original responders of the alert. Default value is false

ignoreOriginalTags.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original tags of the alert. Default value is false

ignoreOriginalTeams.description: If set to true, policy will ignore the original teams of the alert. Default value is false

continue.description: Will continue with other modify policies if set to true

alias.description: Alias of the alert. You can use {{alias}} to refer to the original alias. Default value is {{alias}}

description.description: Description of the alert. You can use {{description}} to refer to the original alert description. Default value is {{description}}

entity.description: Entity field of the alert. You can use {{entity}} to refer to the original entity. Default value is {{entity}}

source.description: Source field of the alert. You can use {{source}} to refer to the original source. Default value is {{source}}

actions.description: Alert actions as a list of strings to add to the alerts original actions value. If ignoreOriginalActions field is set to true, this will replace the original actions.

responders.description: Responders to add to the alerts original responders value as a list of teams or users. If ignoreOriginalResponders field is set to true, this will replace the original responders.

tags.description: Tags to add to the alerts original tags value as a list of strings. If ignoreOriginalTags field is set to true, this will replace the original tags.

details.description: Custom properties to add to the alerts original details value as a list of strings. If ignoreOriginalDetails field is set to true, this will replace the original details.

autoRestartAction.description: Auto-restart action defined for the policy.

autoCloseAction.description: Auto-close action defined for the policy.

deduplicationAction.description: Deduplication action defined for the policy.

delayAction.description: Delay action defined for the policy.

suppress.description: If set to true, notifications related to the matching alert will be suppressed. Default value is false.

title.description: The message to be added using status page into incident

details.description: Description of the message being added via stats page into incident

description.description: Description field of the incident that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the incident.

responders.description: Responders that the incident will be routed to send notifications

details.description: Map of key-value pairs to use as custom properties of the incident

note.description: Additional note that will be added while creating the incident

serviceId.description: Service on which incident will be created.

statusPageEntry.description: Status page entry fields. If this field is leaved blank, message and description of incident will be used for title and detail respectively.

notifyStakeholders.description: Indicate whether stakeholders are notified or not. Default value is false.

note.description: Additional note that will be included with the incident

extraProperties.description: Map of key-value pairs to use as custom properties of the incident

description.description: Description field of the service that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the service.
Description field of the service that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the service.
Description field of the service that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the service.

field.description: Specifies which alert field will be used in condition. Possible values are message, description, tags, extra-properties, recipients, teams or priority

key.description: If field is set as extra-properties, key could be used for key-value pair

not.description: Indicates behaviour of the given operation. Default value is false

operation.description: It is the operation that will be executed for the given field and key.

expectedValue.description: User defined value that will be compared with alert field according to the operation. Default value is empty string

message.description: Message of the related incident rule.

details.description: Map of key-value pairs to use as custom properties of the alert.

description.description: Description field of the incident rule.

priority.description: Priority level of the alert. Possible values are P1, P2, P3, P4 and P5

enable.description: Option to enable stakeholder notifications.Default value is true.

message.description: Message that is to be passed to audience that is generally used to provide a content information about the alert.

description.description: Description that is generally used to provide a detailed information about the alert.

conditionMatchType.description: Match type for given conditions. Possible values are [match-all-conditions, match-any-condition]. Default value is [match-any-condition].

matchField.description: Field to be matched for users. Possible values are [country, state, city, zipCode, line, tag, customProperty]. customProperty can be used while actionType is keyValue.

key.description: If matchField is customProperty, key must be given.

value.description: Value to be check for the match field.
